edu.rpi.tw.data.excel

Class XLStoCSV

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV

  • public class XLStoCSV
extends java.lang.Object
    Example usage 1: $ ls STELPRDC5087258.xls STELPRDC5087258.xls.pml.ttl $ java edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV STELPRDC5087258.xls $ ls STELPRDC5087258.xls STELPRDC5087258.xls.pml.ttl STELPRDC5087258_tblFMDirectory2011.xls.csv Example usage 2: $ ls source/ STELPRDC5087258.xls STELPRDC5087258.xls.pml.ttl $ java edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV source/STELPRDC5087258.xls -od manual $ ls manual/ STELPRDC5087258_tblFMDirectory2011.xls.csv ------------------------ unit test materials at csv2rdf4lod/test/source/lebot/multisheet-xls-to-csv/version/2011-12-29 bash-3.2$ ls source/*.xls source/Workbook0.xls # a single sheet source/Workbook1.xls # two sheets source/Workbook2.xls # two sheets Example 3: A workbook with a single sheet is printed to stdout. bash-3.2$ java edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV source/Workbook0.xls c1 r1,c2 r1,c3 r1, c1 r2,c2 r2,c3 r2, Example 4: When the workbook has multiple sheets, each sheet is written to a separate file. The new files are written in the same directory as the input file. bash-3.2$ java edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV source/Workbook1.xls source/Workbook1_Sheet1.xls.csv source/Workbook1_Sheet2.xls.csv bash-3.2$ bash-3.2$ ls source/Workbook1* | less source/Workbook1.xls source/Workbook1_Sheet1.xls.csv <-- new file source/Workbook1_Sheet2.xls.csv <-- new file Example 5: When multiple workbooks are given, they are ALL written to separate files. bash-3.2$ java edu.rpi.tw.data.excel.XLStoCSV source/Workbook0.xls source/Workbook1.xls Workbook0.xls.csv Workbook1_Sheet1.xls.csv Workbook1_Sheet2.xls.csv bash-3.2$ ls source Workbook0.xls.csv <-- "_Sheet1" is superfluous here, so it is omitted. Workbook1_Sheet1.xls.csv Workbook1_Sheet2.xls.csv

      • outputFileName

        public static java.lang.String outputFileName(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                              java.lang.String sheetName,
                              int sheetNumber,
                              int numSheets,
                              int fileBatchSize,
                              boolean writeSingle,
                              java.lang.String outputDirectoryPath)
        Return the name of the file that is created by processing the given sheet. If empty, output should go to stdout.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - - the input file
        sheetName - -
        sheetNumber - - the sheet number (1 based, as in 1 of 1)
        numSheets - - the number of sheets in this input (1 based, as in 1 of 4)
        fileBatchSize - - the number of input file listed when conversion was invoked.
        writeSingle - - if only one file and one sheet, write to file? (as opposed to stdout)
        outputDirectoryPath - - directory to write output files
        Returns:
